Description: Gold finger-ring; elliptical hoop; large oval carnelian intaglio in raised setting: portrait of a woman with veil over the back of her head; she wears a wreath of corn; perhaps an idealised portrait of Arsinoe II as Demeter.
Bibliographic references: Finger Ring / Catalogue of the Finger Rings, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum (367)
Gem / Catalogue of Engraved Gems & Cameos, Greek, Etruscan & Roman in the British Museum (1185)
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
